intro: Cymbalaria microcalyx subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed figwort, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open fields or along coastal areas. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its longer stems compared to other varieties within the species.
